summary: The No DeepSeek on Government Devices Act prohibits the use of the DeepSeek application (and any successor) by executive agencies.  The bill mandates that the Director of the Office of Management and Budget, in consultation with various agencies, develop standards and guidelines for removing the application from government information technology within 60 days of the Act's enactment. It includes exceptions for law enforcement, national security, and security research, along with requirements for risk mitigation when the application is used under an exception.
